intro: Astronia cuernosensis, commonly known as the horned astronia, is a flowering plant native to the humid regions of Mexico. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its unique, horn-like structures on its leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Astronia cuernosensis is considered an endangered species.
